text: Hush is an album by Bobby McFerrin and cellist Yo-Yo Ma. == Track listing == # "Grace" (McFerrin) – 3:54 # "Double Mandolin Concerto in G, RV 532" Andante (Vivaldi) – 4:03 # "The Flight of the Bumblebee" (Rimsky-Korsakov) – 1:08 # "Stars" (McFerrin) – 4:04 # "Hush Little Baby" (Trad.) – 2:36 # "Vocalise," song for voice & piano, Op. 34/14 (Rachmaninov) – 6:26 # "Musette for keyboard in D Major (AMN II/22; doubtful), BWV Anh. 126" (Bach) – 4:12 # "Coyote" (McFerrin) – 2:52 # "Sonata for 2 cellos, No. 10 in G Allegro Prestissimo" (Barrière) – 2:36 # "Ave Maria" (Gounod / Bach) – 2:37 # "Hoedown!" (McFerrin) – 5:38 # "Orchestral Suite No. 3 in D Major, BWV 1068" ("Air") (Bach) – 5:11 # "Good-bye" (McFerrin) – 1:11 == Personnel == * Yo-Yo Ma – Cello, Liner Notes * Bobby McFerrin – Arranger, Vocals, Producer, Performer, Liner Notes == Production == * Steven Epstein – Producer * Carol Friedman – Cover Photo * Linda Goldstein – Producer, Executive Producer * Chris Tergesen – Engineer, Mixing Engineer * Allen Weinberg – Cover Design ==References== Category:Bobby McFerrin albums Category:Yo-Yo Ma albums Category:1992 albums Category:Vocal–instrumental duet albums
title: Hush (Yo-Yo Ma and Bobby McFerrin album)
